lexUnit.definition: FN: a building housing a order of monks.

sentence.text: The church then came to the Order of the Shod Carmelites who built a monastery and rebuilt the church from 1723-38 .

Sha Tin is the site of the Monastery of 10,000 Buddhas , which looks down on a burgeoning town .
There is a total of 12,800 Buddha statues here , plus the remains of the monastery 's founder embalmed in gold leaf .
The statue and a small museum are on a peak , up 268 steps , above Po Lin Monastery .
The monastery is strictly vegetarian , and visitors are warned not to bring any meat with them .

From the monastery , hikers enjoy the two - hour cross-country trek down to Silvermine Bay , but the authorities have warned walkers to be on the lookout for snakes , which can be plentiful in the Lantau hinterland , especially in summer .
The hillsides that surround the monastery are the site of Hong Kong 's only tea plantation .
A Trappist monastery , situated on a hillside overlooking the east coast of Lantau , is also open to visitors .
An unexpected piece of historical memorabilia turns up in the monastery garden , where guides point out a small stone table used for a treaty - signing ceremony in 1844 .
